You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 481, 565, 496]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 529, 550, 544]]<|/det|> - You should use a scientific calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 335, 559]]<|/det|> - You may use tracing paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 466, 575]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 856, 590]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 490, 620]]<|/det|> - For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 214, 662]]<|/det|> # INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 388, 682]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 80. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 730, 698]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 567, 90]]<|/det|>
List of formulas

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 117, 680, 146]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of triangle, base \(b\), height \(h\). \(A=\frac{1}{2} b h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 170, 660, 188]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(A=\pi r^{2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 219, 675, 235]]<|/det|>
Circumference, \(C\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(C=2 \pi r\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 267, 680, 284]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(A=2 \pi r h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 314, 543, 333]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A=\pi r l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 361, 679, 380]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A=4 \pi r^{2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 410, 490, 427]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of prism, cross-sectional area \(A\), length \(l\). \(V=A l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 451, 435, 479]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V=\frac{1}{3} A h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 505, 421, 524]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V=\pi r^{2} h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 550, 396, 571]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cone of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V=\frac{1}{3} \pi r^{2} h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 599, 338, 620]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}\)
